pullRequest.title: adding helm implementation
pullRequest.bodyText:
Adding HelmParams class
OperatorParams, TraefikParams extend HelmParams
Implementation added in Helm class for install, upgrade, delete methods.
Operator, Traefik extend Helm now.
ItSimpleOperatorValidation - installs operator and verifies operator pod is running

commit.message: moving common props to helmprops and common methods to helm class

nodes.bodyText:
-> "Created a new namespace called ..."
Doesn't the logger facade in the operator support String formats like "blah blah {0}"?  Shouldn't we use the logging facade in operator rather than java.util.logging directly?
Every assertion should have a short message that would help someone debug the issue should it occur.

These combinations are easier to read and debug if they are separate. Like:
assertNotNull(params.getRepoUrl(), "repo URL was not provided")
or
assertThat(params.getRepoUrl())
.as("repo URL was not provided")
. isNotNull()
.isNotEmpty();
same as previous (combo check)
combo check
this is the logger injected by LoggedTest isn't it?

@rjeberhard @ddsharpe interested in your opinion on this --- seems like assertions in the finally is somehow wrong -- if these are important, should they not be part of the test itself?   not sure about assertions in a finally block.....
i need to take a much closer look at this, my gut reaction is that inheritance here is not the best solution
same here
the as() describes what the test is, it is not the failure message

nitpick - start each new fluent method on a new line please, like this
new V1ObejctMeta()
  .namespace(opNamespace)
  .name(serviceAccountName)
oh it's both - it is injected, but it as a JUL
@ddsharpe we should fix that in LoggedTest

seems like an operator is much more than just a set of helm params
maybe we could implement HelmRelease
or have a variable that is a HelmParams
i think an action impl should never extend a primitive
they should use primitives, not "be" them... imo
same comment about inheritance

i think this is not ideal - if it fails, how will we know which of the two commands failed?
i think it would be better to run each one separately and then inspect the results
i know is it "more work" - but i think it is much clearer and will produce more reliable code to do if we do it that way
captials and periods please
nitpick: if you say it returns true on success, no need to say false otherwise, that is pretty clear :)
these are really nice
yeah i think String.format() would be a lot cleaner to read
same comment as before

capitals, period.
Helm has a capital H
cap, period
period
nitpick: if this method "executes" a command, then it is probably nicer to say "the command to execute"

These feel like the should maybe be debug level messages, not info
@rjeberhard @ddsharpe what do you think?
capital H

nodes.bodyText: This is the part I was discussing in the channel... Depending on the sort of cluster, the image may need to be pushed or not.  But, I guess this can wait and need not be part of this pull request.
You don't need the formatting here (the hyphen)... that will generated Javadoc that starts with this symbol.

Why the strange name?  It's because you don't want the same name as TestActions.createUninqueNamespace(), correct :(?  The "InTryBlock" portion of the name looks strange.  Can this just be createNamespace()?
what class should it be?
